member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionRequest
member.summary: Contains the details of the transaction to commit.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionRequest.CommitDigest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CommitDigest.
Specifies the commit digest for the transaction to commit. For every active transaction, the commit digest must be passed. QLDB validates CommitDigest and rejects the commit with an error if the digest computed on the client does not match the digest computed by QLDB.
The purpose of the CommitDigest parameter is to ensure that QLDB commits a transaction if and only if the server has processed the exact set of statements sent by the client, in the same order that client sent them, and with no duplicates.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionRequest.TransactionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransactionId.
Specifies the transaction ID of the transaction to commit.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionResult
member.summary: Contains the details of the committed transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionResult.CommitDigest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CommitDigest.
The commit digest of the committed transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionResult.ConsumedIOs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConsumedIOs.
Contains metrics about the number of I/O requests that were consumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionResult.TimingInformation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimingInformation.
Contains server-side performance information for the command.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.CommitTransactionResult.TransactionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransactionId.
The transaction ID of the committed transaction.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the SendCommand operation. Sends a command to an Amazon QLDB ledger.
Instead of interacting directly with this API, we recommend using the QLDB driver or the QLDB shell to execute data transactions on a ledger.
If you are working with an AWS SDK, use the QLDB driver. The driver provides a high-level abstraction layer above this QLDB Session data plane and manages SendCommand API calls for you. For information and a list of supported programming languages, see Getting started with the driver in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If you are working with the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), use the QLDB shell. The shell is a command line interface that uses the QLDB driver to interact with a ledger. For information, see Accessing Amazon QLDB using the QLDB shell.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.AbortTransaction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AbortTransaction.
Command to abort the current transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.CommitTransaction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CommitTransaction.
Command to commit the specified transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.EndSession
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndSession.
Command to end the current session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.ExecuteStatement
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecuteStatement.
Command to execute a statement in the specified transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.FetchPage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FetchPage.
Command to fetch a page.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.SessionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionToken.
Specifies the session token for the current command. A session token is constant throughout the life of the session.
To obtain a session token, run the StartSession command. This SessionToken is required for every subsequent command that is issued during the current session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.StartSession
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartSession.
Command to start a new session. A session token is obtained as part of the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest.StartTransaction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTransaction.
Command to start a new transaction.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the SendCommand operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.AbortTransaction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AbortTransaction.
Contains the details of the aborted transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.CommitTransaction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CommitTransaction.
Contains the details of the committed transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.EndSession
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndSession.
Contains the details of the ended session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.ExecuteStatement
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecuteStatement.
Contains the details of the executed statement.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.FetchPage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FetchPage.
Contains the details of the fetched page.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.StartSession
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartSession.
Contains the details of the started session that includes a session token. This SessionToken is required for every subsequent command that is issued during the current session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandResponse.StartTransaction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTransaction.
Contains the details of the started transaction.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartSessionRequest
member.summary: Specifies a request to start a new session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartSessionRequest.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger to start a new session against.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartSessionResult
member.summary: Contains the details of the started session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartSessionResult.SessionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionToken.
Session token of the started session. This SessionToken is required for every subsequent command that is issued during the current session.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartSessionResult.TimingInformation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimingInformation.
Contains server-side performance information for the command.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartTransactionRequest
member.summary: Specifies a request to start a transaction.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartTransactionResult
member.summary: Contains the details of the started transaction.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartTransactionResult.TimingInformation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimingInformation.
Contains server-side performance information for the command.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.StartTransactionResult.TransactionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransactionId.
The transaction ID of the started transaction.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.TimingInformation
member.summary: Contains server-side performance information for a command. Amazon QLDB captures timing information between the times when it receives the request and when it sends the corresponding response.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.TimingInformation.ProcessingTimeMilliseconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProcessingTimeMilliseconds.
The amount of time that QLDB spent on processing the command, measured in milliseconds.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.ValueHolder
member.summary: A structure that can contain a value in multiple encoding formats.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.ValueHolder.IonBinary
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IonBinary.
An Amazon Ion binary value contained in a ValueHolder structure.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.ValueHolder.IonText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IonText.
An Amazon Ion plaintext value contained in a ValueHolder structure.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.AmazonQLDBSessionRequest
member.summary: Base class for QLDBSession operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDBSession.AmazonQLDBSessionClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing QLDBSession
The transactional data APIs for Amazon QLDB
Instead of interacting directly with this API, we recommend using the QLDB driver or the QLDB shell to execute data transactions on a ledger.
If you are working with an AWS SDK, use the QLDB driver. The driver provides a high-level abstraction layer above this QLDB Session data plane and manages SendCommand API calls for you. For information and a list of supported programming languages, see Getting started with the driver in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If you are working with the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), use the QLDB shell. The shell is a command line interface that uses the QLDB driver to interact with a ledger. For information, see Accessing Amazon QLDB using the QLDB shell.

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDBSession.AmazonQLDBSessionClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonQLDBSessionClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDBSession.AmazonQLDBSessionClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDBSession.AmazonQLDBSessionClient.SendCommand(Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest)
member.summary:
Sends a command to an Amazon QLDB ledger.
Instead of interacting directly with this API, we recommend using the QLDB driver or the QLDB shell to execute data transactions on a ledger.
If you are working with an AWS SDK, use the QLDB driver. The driver provides a high-level abstraction layer above this QLDB Session data plane and manages SendCommand API calls for you. For information and a list of supported programming languages, see Getting started with the driver in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If you are working with the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), use the QLDB shell. The shell is a command line interface that uses the QLDB driver to interact with a ledger. For information, see Accessing Amazon QLDB using the QLDB shell.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SendCommand service method.
member.returns: The response from the SendCommand service method, as returned by QLDBSession.
member.exception: Returned if the request is malformed or contains an error such as an invalid parameter value or a missing required parameter.
Returned when the request exceeds the processing capacity of the ledger.
Returned if the session doesn't exist anymore because it timed out or expired.
Returned if a resource limit such as number of active sessions is exceeded.
Returned when a transaction cannot be written to the journal due to a failure in the verification phase of optimistic concurrency control (OCC).
Returned when the rate of requests exceeds the allowed throughput.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SendCommand Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDBSession.AmazonQLDBSessionClient.SendCommandAsync(Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Sends a command to an Amazon QLDB ledger.
Instead of interacting directly with this API, we recommend using the QLDB driver or the QLDB shell to execute data transactions on a ledger.
If you are working with an AWS SDK, use the QLDB driver. The driver provides a high-level abstraction layer above this QLDB Session data plane and manages SendCommand API calls for you. For information and a list of supported programming languages, see Getting started with the driver in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If you are working with the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), use the QLDB shell. The shell is a command line interface that uses the QLDB driver to interact with a ledger. For information, see Accessing Amazon QLDB using the QLDB shell.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SendCommand service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the SendCommand service method, as returned by QLDBSession.
member.exception: Returned if the request is malformed or contains an error such as an invalid parameter value or a missing required parameter.
Returned when the request exceeds the processing capacity of the ledger.
Returned if the session doesn't exist anymore because it timed out or expired.
Returned if a resource limit such as number of active sessions is exceeded.
Returned when a transaction cannot be written to the journal due to a failure in the verification phase of optimistic concurrency control (OCC).
Returned when the rate of requests exceeds the allowed throughput.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SendCommand Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDBSession.IAmazonQLDBSession.SendCommandAsync(Amazon.QLDBSession.Model.SendCommandRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Sends a command to an Amazon QLDB ledger.
Instead of interacting directly with this API, we recommend using the QLDB driver or the QLDB shell to execute data transactions on a ledger.
If you are working with an AWS SDK, use the QLDB driver. The driver provides a high-level abstraction layer above this QLDB Session data plane and manages SendCommand API calls for you. For information and a list of supported programming languages, see Getting started with the driver in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If you are working with the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), use the QLDB shell. The shell is a command line interface that uses the QLDB driver to interact with a ledger. For information, see Accessing Amazon QLDB using the QLDB shell.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SendCommand service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the SendCommand service method, as returned by QLDBSession.
member.exception: Returned if the request is malformed or contains an error such as an invalid parameter value or a missing required parameter.
Returned when the request exceeds the processing capacity of the ledger.
Returned if the session doesn't exist anymore because it timed out or expired.
Returned if a resource limit such as number of active sessions is exceeded.
Returned when a transaction cannot be written to the journal due to a failure in the verification phase of optimistic concurrency control (OCC).
Returned when the rate of requests exceeds the allowed throughput.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SendCommand Operation
